items.title: Why JPMorgan Chase, Wells Fargo, and American Express Plunged Today
items.description: Shares of major financial companies JPMorgan Chase (NYSE: JPM), Wells Fargo (NYSE: WFC), and Warren Buffett holding American Express (NYSE: AXP) were all down significantly on Monday, falling 3.8%, 5.1%, and 2.9%, respectively, as of 12:04 p.m. ET.  Uncertainty over Trump's tariff policy has recently led to recession or stagflation fears; over the weekend, Trump declined to rule out tolerating a recession as a result of the protectionist policies.

items.title: AmEx Enhances Card Capabilities With Center Acquisition
items.description: AXP announces the acquisition of Center in a bid to enhance its commercial card offerings.
